124	
125	    def __new__(
126	        cls, login: str, password: str = "", encoding: str = "latin1"
127	    ) -> "BasicAuth":
128	        if login is None:
129	            raise ValueError("None is not allowed as login value")
130	
131	        if password is None:
132	            raise ValueError("None is not allowed as password value")
133	
134	        if ":" in login:
135	            raise ValueError('A ":" is not allowed in login (RFC 1945#section-11.1)')
136	
137	        return super().__new__(cls, login, password, encoding)
138

41	        scope=None,

43	        leeway=60,
44	        **kwargs,
45	    ):

--------------------------------------------------
>> Issue: [B107:hardcoded_password_default] Possible hardcoded password: '@$@'
   Severity: Low   Confidence: Medium
   CWE: CWE-259 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/259.html)
   More Info: https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/1.8.3/plugins/b107_hardcoded_password_default.html
   Location: .\.venv\Lib\site-packages\nltk\grammar.py:739:4
738	
739	    def chomsky_normal_form(self, new_token_padding="@$@", flexible=False):
740	        """
741	        Returns a new Grammar that is in chomsky normal
742	
743	        :param: new_token_padding
744	            Customise new rule formation during binarisation
745	        """
746	        if self.is_chomsky_normal_form():
747	            return self
748	        if self.productions(empty=True):
749	            raise ValueError(
750	                "Grammar has Empty rules. " "Cannot deal with them at the moment"
751	            )
752	
753	        # check for mixed rules
754	        for rule in self.productions():
755	            if rule.is_lexical() and len(rule.rhs()) > 1:
756	                raise ValueError(
757	                    f"Cannot handled mixed rule {rule.lhs()} => {rule.rhs()}"
758	                )
759	
760	        step1 = CFG.eliminate_start(self)
761	        step2 = CFG.binarize(step1, new_token_padding)
762	        if flexible:
763	            return step2
764	        step3 = CFG.remove_unitary_rules(step2)
765	        step4 = CFG(step3.start(), list(set(step3.productions())))
766	        return step4
767

1179	
1180	def set_proxy(proxy, user=None, password=""):
1181	    """
1182	    Set the HTTP proxy for Python to download through.
1183	
1184	    If ``proxy`` is None then tries to set proxy from environment or system
1185	    settings.
1186	
1187	    :param proxy: The HTTP proxy server to use. For example:
1188	        'http://proxy.example.com:3128/'
1189	    :param user: The username to authenticate with. Use None to disable
1190	        authentication.
1191	    :param password: The password to authenticate with.
1192	    """
1193	    if proxy is None:
1194	        # Try and find the system proxy settings
1195	        try:
1196	            proxy = getproxies()["http"]
1197	        except KeyError as e:
1198	            raise ValueError("Could not detect default proxy settings") from e
1199	
1200	    # Set up the proxy handler
1201	    proxy_handler = ProxyHandler({"https": proxy, "http": proxy})
1202	    opener = build_opener(proxy_handler)
1203	
1204	    if user is not None:
1205	        # Set up basic proxy authentication if provided
1206	        password_manager = HTTPPasswordMgrWithDefaultRealm()
1207	        password_manager.add_password(realm=None, uri=proxy, user=user, passwd=password)
1208	        opener.add_handler(ProxyBasicAuthHandler(password_manager))
1209	        opener.add_handler(ProxyDigestAuthHandler(password_manager))
1210	
1211	    # Override the existing url opener
1212	    install_opener(opener)
1213

2629	def _parse_multi_options(options, split_token=','):
2630	    r"""Split and strip and discard empties.
2631	
2632	    Turns the following:
2633	
2634	    A,
2635	    B,
2636	
2637	    into ["A", "B"]
2638	    """
2639	    if options:
2640	        return [o.strip() for o in options.split(split_token) if o.strip()]
2641	    else:
2642	        return options

   Location: .\venv\Lib\site-packages\aiohttp\helpers.py:125:4
124	
125	    def __new__(
126	        cls, login: str, password: str = "", encoding: str = "latin1"
127	    ) -> "BasicAuth":
128	        if login is None:
129	            raise ValueError("None is not allowed as login value")
130	
131	        if password is None:
132	            raise ValueError("None is not allowed as password value")
133	
134	        if ":" in login:

53	    def __init__(
54	        self,
55	        session,
56	        client_id=None,
57	        client_secret=None,
58	        token_endpoint_auth_method=None,
59	        revocation_endpoint_auth_method=None,
60	        scope=None,
61	        state=None,
62	        redirect_uri=None,
63	        code_challenge_method=None,
64	        token=None,
65	        token_placement="header",
66	        update_token=None,
67	        leeway=60,
68	        **metadata,
69	    ):
70	        self.session = session
71	        self.client_id = client_id
72	        self.client_secret = client_secret
73	        self.state = state
74	
75	        if token_endpoint_auth_method is None:
76	            if client_secret:
77	                token_endpoint_auth_method = "client_secret_basic"
78	            else:
79	                token_endpoint_auth_method = "none"
80	
81	        self.token_endpoint_auth_method = token_endpoint_auth_method
82	
83	        if revocation_endpoint_auth_method is None:
84	            if client_secret:
85	                revocation_endpoint_auth_method = "client_secret_basic"
86	            else:
87	                revocation_endpoint_auth_method = "none"
88	
89	        self.revocation_endpoint_auth_method = revocation_endpoint_auth_method
90	
91	        self.scope = scope
92	        self.redirect_uri = redirect_uri
93	        self.code_challenge_method = code_challenge_method
94	
95	        self.token_auth = self.token_auth_class(token, token_placement, self)
96	        self.update_token = update_token
97	
98	        token_updater = metadata.pop("token_updater", None)
99	        if token_updater:
100	            raise ValueError(
101	                "update token has been redesigned, checkout the documentation"
102	            )
103	
104	        self.metadata = metadata
105

>> Issue: [B107:hardcoded_password_default] Possible hardcoded password: '@$@'
   Severity: Low   Confidence: Medium
   CWE: CWE-259 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/259.html)
   More Info: https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/1.8.3/plugins/b107_hardcoded_password_default.html
   Location: .\venv\Lib\site-packages\nltk\grammar.py:739:4
738	
739	    def chomsky_normal_form(self, new_token_padding="@$@", flexible=False):
740	        """
741	        Returns a new Grammar that is in chomsky normal
742	
743	        :param: new_token_padding
744	            Customise new rule formation during binarisation
745	        """
746	        if self.is_chomsky_normal_form():
747	            return self
748	        if self.productions(empty=True):
749	            raise ValueError(
750	                "Grammar has Empty rules. " "Cannot deal with them at the moment"
751	            )
752	
753	        # check for mixed rules
754	        for rule in self.productions():
755	            if rule.is_lexical() and len(rule.rhs()) > 1:
756	                raise ValueError(
757	                    f"Cannot handled mixed rule {rule.lhs()} => {rule.rhs()}"
758	                )
759	
760	        step1 = CFG.eliminate_start(self)
761	        step2 = CFG.binarize(step1, new_token_padding)
762	        if flexible:
763	            return step2
764	        step3 = CFG.remove_unitary_rules(step2)
765	        step4 = CFG(step3.start(), list(set(step3.productions())))
766	        return step4
767

   Location: .\venv\Lib\site-packages\nltk\util.py:1179:0
1178	
1179	def set_proxy(proxy, user=None, password=""):
1180	    """
1181	    Set the HTTP proxy for Python to download through.
1182	
1183	    If ``proxy`` is None then tries to set proxy from environment or system
1184	    settings.
1185	
1186	    :param proxy: The HTTP proxy server to use. For example:
1187	        'http://proxy.example.com:3128/'
1188	    :param user: The username to authenticate with. Use None to disable
1189	        authentication.
1190	    :param password: The password to authenticate with.
1191	    """
1192	    if proxy is None:
1193	        # Try and find the system proxy settings
1194	        try:
1195	            proxy = getproxies()["http"]
1196	        except KeyError as e:
1197	            raise ValueError("Could not detect default proxy settings") from e
1198	
1199	    # Set up the proxy handler
1200	    proxy_handler = ProxyHandler({"https": proxy, "http": proxy})
1201	    opener = build_opener(proxy_handler)
1202	
1203	    if user is not None:
1204	        # Set up basic proxy authentication if provided
1205	        password_manager = HTTPPasswordMgrWithDefaultRealm()
1206	        password_manager.add_password(realm=None, uri=proxy, user=user, passwd=password)
1207	        opener.add_handler(ProxyBasicAuthHandler(password_manager))
1208	        opener.add_handler(ProxyDigestAuthHandler(password_manager))
1209	
1210	    # Override the existing url opener
1211	    install_opener(opener)
1212

2629	def _parse_multi_options(options, split_token=','):
2630	    r"""Split and strip and discard empties.
2631	
2632	    Turns the following:
2633	
2634	    A,
2635	    B,
2636	
2637	    into ["A", "B"]
2638	    """
2639	    if options:
2640	        return [o.strip() for o in options.split(split_token) if o.strip()]

2642	        return options
